column4: So what's the consensus on sudo passwd root?  Should we be advising people to set a root password for backdoor repairs when sudo is broken or is it sufficient to advise people to reboot in single user mode (aka recovery mode) to gain access?

what you do in the privacy of your own command line is your business, but we should understand the "normal state" of a machine when a user comes in here then they can get help, when something extraordinary happens then issues occur and theboth the user and helper are frustrated
so you propose what I view as loose loose
